description: Robbins triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of alternating sign n X n matrices with a 1 at top of column k (n >= 1, 1<=k<=n)
comments: An alternating sign matrix is a matrix of 0's and 1's such that (a) the sum of each row and column is 1; (b) the nonzero entries in each row and column alternate in sign.
references: D. Bressoud, Proofs and Confirmations: The Story of the Alternating Sign Matrix Conjecture, Cambridge University Press, 1999, p. 5.
